title: Bug 5473: ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that the two lines are indented the same visually, and then ShiftLeft is executed, the text does not move as expected. The behavior is confusing, as it is not clear why the text won't shift. In the first scenario, it seems like the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., the tab should be treated as a regular space). Additionally, it is hard to determine if the presence of a stray space is causing the confusion.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the two lines are visually indented the same.
2. Execute the ShiftLeft operation.
3. Verify that the first line is shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., the tab is treated as a regular space) and the second line is also shifted left. 
4. Verify that there are no stray spaces that may cause confusion in the behavior of the ShiftLeft operation.
